intro: Lysionotus gracilis, commonly known as the slender starwort, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has slender, branching stems and finely divided leaves that resemble those of other members of its family. Lysionotus gracilis is often found in wetlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
